text: Pour sequence and method approved by structural/consultant team
Pre-pour meeting held with relevant trades, foremen, and inspectors
Formwork inspection completed and signed off
Reinforcement and embeds verified prior to placement
Weather conditions checked and recorded
Mix design approved and verified (type, strength, slump, admixtures)
Access routes, pump lines, chutes, and pour equipment inspected
Required inspection team and third-party testing agency present
Delivery ticket checked (batch time, slump, mix type, air, temperature)
Slump, temperature, and air content tests conducted at site
Cylinders/cubes cast for compressive strength testing
Concrete within allowable time limit from batching to placement
Concrete placed as per approved plan and sequence
Concrete not dropped from height > 5 ft without chute/trunk
No cold joints or segregation observed during placement
Consolidation/vibration performed correctly and continuously
Vibrator type, spacing, and technique verified
Concrete uniformly distributed and leveled to required finish elevation
Surface finish per contract requirements (trowel, broom, etc.)
Formwork labeled and scheduled for removal as per curing requirement
Initial curing started immediately using approved methods (covering, water, curing compound)
Final curing arrangements in place (wet cure, membrane, insulation if cold)
All data (temps, test results, pour log) recorded and signed by QA/QC

id: • CSA A23.1 – Concrete Materials and Methods of Construction
• CSA A23.2 – Methods of Testing Concrete
• ACI 301 / ACI 309 – Specifications for Concrete Construction & Consolidation
